question:
Which of the following kings were defeated by King Dhruva?
1) Nagabhatta II
2) Dharmapala
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: During the reign of Dhruva (c. 780 - 793 CE), the Rashtrakuta kingdom expanded into an empire that encompassed all of the territory between the Kaveri River and Central India. He led successful expeditions to Kannauj and defeated the King Nagabhatta II. He also defeated the Palas of Bengal (Dharmapala).
